content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
This paper proposes an electrophysiological wireless patient monitoring system which integrates a Wireless ECG signal transmitter, GPS device and a mobile phone to acquire physiological signals and transmit them to a local server via Bluetooth wireless technology. Four kinds of monitor units were specially designed for a wireless communication, including a control center , a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistant; PDA), and a Web page (for both patient and doctor). The use of various monitor units is created to fulfill different medical personnel requirements and wishes. This application was developed to promote the mobility and flexibility for the patients and also for the medical personnel, which further will improve both the quality of health care and lifestyle of the patient.

DC: Child
ILT: Medium
Is the current version of the passage suitable for the given DC (Child)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Identify a single complicated section of the passage

The section "an electrophysiological wireless patient monitoring system which integrates a Wireless ECG signal transmitter, GPS device and a mobile phone to acquire physiological signals and transmit them to a local server via Bluetooth wireless technology" is complicated.
Simplify this section

This paper describes a system that lets doctors check patients' health remotely using a wireless ECG machine, a GPS device, and a mobile phone to collect and send health data to a local server using Bluetooth.
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage

This paper describes a system that lets doctors check patients' health remotely using a wireless ECG machine, a GPS device, and a mobile phone to collect and send health data to a local server using Bluetooth. Four kinds of monitor units were specially designed for wireless communication, including a control center, a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistant; PDA), and a web page (for both patients and doctors). The use of various monitor units is created to fulfill different medical personnel requirements and wishes. This application was developed to promote the mobility and flexibility for the patients and also for the medical personnel, which further will improve both the quality of health care and lifestyle of the patient.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

1. Information Loss: The detailed description of how the system operates (the specifics of signal acquisition and transmission) is less emphasized.
   - Severity: Medium

2. Information Loss: The term "electrophysiological" is removed, which might reduce clarity about the type of monitoring.
   - Severity: Medium

3. Information Loss: The original passage mentions "integrates," which suggests a more complex interaction among devices that is simplified in the new version.
   - Severity: Medium

Overall, while the simplified passage retains the main idea, there are notable aspects of technical detail that have been lost, which may affect understanding. The severity of information loss is deemed medium for multiple points. Therefore, the change would be rejected based on the ILT criteria.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text

This paper describes a wireless patient monitoring system that allows doctors to check patients' health remotely. It uses a wireless ECG machine, a GPS device, and a mobile phone to collect and send health data to a local server using Bluetooth. Four types of monitor units were specially designed for wireless communication: a control center, a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistant; PDA), and a web page for both patients and doctors. These different monitor units are created to meet the various needs and requests of medical personnel. This application was developed to promote mobility and flexibility for both patients and medical staff, which will help improve the quality of health care and enhance patients' lifestyles.
Is the current version of the passage suitable for the given DC (Child)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Provide the final version of the simplified passage

This paper describes a wireless patient monitoring system that allows doctors to check patients' health remotely. It uses a wireless ECG machine, a GPS device, and a mobile phone to collect and send health data to a local server using Bluetooth. Four types of monitor units were specially designed for wireless communication: a control center, a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistant; PDA), and a web page for both patients and doctors. These different monitor units are created to meet the various needs and requests of medical personnel. This application was developed to promote mobility and flexibility for both patients and medical staff, which will help improve the quality of health care and enhance patients' lifestyles.
